channel.title: Partition Web Developer Badge
channel.description:
I think having the web developer badge makes things a bit complicated now...
How I see it and based on who has it or got it in the past, those proficient with PHP, HTML, and CSS got this award but now with so many different frameworks being used in web development it just no longer makes sense to have an umbrella badge which might imply one is proficient in every popular framework these days.
So, I think web developer should be split up separately into JS, PHP, and a web designer rank to help be more specific (considering Python and now Ruby badges exist). Thoughts?

item.title: Partition Web Developer Badge
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:110, topic:545116”]I’ve got 4 badges here:

http://puu.sh/au5Ve/dd79221eed.png

2 only show and the end one clips into quotes and stuff.[/quote]

Wow that looks nothing like what is in my browser… Which browser are you using? Also, the badges need to be cropped into icons otherwise it will clip. The way we have the badges set up right now there is no way we can fit them three in a row nicely.

Read full topic

item.title: Partition Web Developer Badge
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:106, topic:545116”][quote author=Elrick link=topic=663998.msg4439869#msg4439869 date=1406216052]

I don’t see why any of this wouldn’t be done… It all makes sense.

No one’s saying it doesn’t make sense, but who has the time to write the mod? It’s the same with almost every suggestion that comes through here. It all makes sense and would improve the site but someone has to write X and Y and anyone who’s capable is too busy.

Just wondering, how difficult would it be to code something like this?
[/quote]
It depends how you do it. If you were making a whole new mod then that makes it a bit more advanced but if someone was to edit the layout of the current mod, anyone with basic design knowledge could figure it out. Add a tooltip addon that you’ll find somewhere online and edit the CSS so it displays three awards inline, that’s about it.

Bearing in mind if anyone wants to do this, you can find the forum files here - https://github.com/moparisthebest/moparisthebest.com-smf[/quote]

https://github.com/moparisthebest/moparisthebest.com-smf/pull/9

Read full topic

item.title: Partition Web Developer Badge
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:105, topic:545116”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=663998.msg4439582#msg4439582 date=1406098259]

I don’t see why any of this wouldn’t be done… It all makes sense.

No one’s saying it doesn’t make sense, but who has the time to write the mod? It’s the same with almost every suggestion that comes through here. It all makes sense and would improve the site but someone has to write X and Y and anyone who’s capable is too busy.
[/quote]
Just wondering, how difficult would it be to code something like this?[/quote]
It depends how you do it. If you were making a whole new mod then that makes it a bit more advanced but if someone was to edit the layout of the current mod, anyone with basic design knowledge could figure it out. Add a tooltip addon that you’ll find somewhere online and edit the CSS so it displays three awards inline, that’s about it.

Bearing in mind if anyone wants to do this, you can find the forum files here - https://github.com/moparisthebest/moparisthebest.com-smf

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Davidi2:

??? The normal width meaning the width of the actual content, not including the spacing, ya dingus!

That leaves quite a lot of empty space in the profile area, though. Doing it the way I showed above keeps the badges the same size (makes them stand out more than if they were small) but still fits 3 times as many in the same space.
